page.title: 16LANDSCAPE+BUILDINGS:NEWCSTLE
page.content: I think that in Newcastle town centre, the building that characterises modern building most is Fine Fare. I think this is because it stands out, more than any other building in the whole town centre as the way that buildings are built in 1985. It is a modern building, with colours painted all over it. Not colours that blend in with the town itself, but colours which make it stand out against the rest of our little town. I don't think that this shop, (in one of many), should have been built in Newcastle. It is too much of a contrast towards our small plain town to look right. At least the outer side of the building could have been painted a more pastel shade, not a startling orange and green like it is. I think that this is very thoughtless.
